title: Procedural knowledge in pretraining drives reasoning in large language models
dot:
digraph G{node[shape=box];Title[label="Procedural Knowledge in Pretraining Drives Reasoning in Large Language Models" shape=ellipse];Authors[label="Authors:
Laura Ruis, Maximilian Mozes,
Juhan Bae, Siddhartha Rao Kamalakara,
Dwarak Talupuru, Acyr Locatelli,
Robert Kirk, Tim Rocktäschel,
Edward Grefenstette, Max Bartolo"];Abstract[label="Abstract:
- LLMs show general problem-solving
- Reasoning gaps compared to humans
- Challenges in measuring generalization"];ResearchFocus[label="Research Focus:
- Investigate pretraining data influence
- Analyze reasoning tasks vs factual questions"];Findings[label="Findings:
- Distinct data sets for factual vs reasoning tasks
- Procedural knowledge influences reasoning
- Answers to reasoning questions often not found in influential data"];Methodology[label="Methodology:
- Study 7B and 35B models
- Analyze 2.5B pretraining tokens"];Title->Authors;Title->Abstract;Title->ResearchFocus;ResearchFocus->Methodology;ResearchFocus->Findings;Findings->Methodology;Notes[label="Implications:
- New understanding of LLM reasoning
- Distinction between retrieval and generalization"];Findings->Notes;}
